revised_title: A New Method of Measuring Colour-Sensations by Intermittent Light
tldr: The author presents a new method for measuring colour-sensations using intermittent light and areal induction. The technique involves inducing temporary colour-blindness in a small area of the field of view by alternating monochromatic flashes, allowing the observer to see the boundaries of underlying colour sensations. The author believes this method has the potential to supersede other colour-testing methods.
